question.title: Christmas tree made of asterisks
question.body:
I wanted to create a class called 'ChristmasTree' that generates a tree as shown in the example. The Christmas tree should have a parameter - 'number of floors' (a class member variable), and based on it, the tree should be generated. The top floor should have three rows, each subsequent floor having one more row than the previous one, and the lowest one should touch the left edge of the console. The base consists of five characters, '='. Everything is symmetrical regardless of the parameter value.

    *
   ***
  *****
    *
   ***
  *****
 *******
    *
   ***
  *****
 *******
*********
    H
    H
  =====

I came up with this code, but it doesn't make it symmetrical.

public class ChristmasTree {
    private int numberOfLevels;

    public ChristmasTree(int numberOfLevels) {
        this.numberOfLevels = numberOfLevels;
    }

    public void generateTree() {
        int maxNumberOfLevels = numberOfLevels;
        for (int i = 1; i <= numberOfLevels; i++) {
            int numberOfSpaces = (maxNumberOfLevels + numberOfLevels) / 2 - i;
            System.out.println(" ".repeat(numberOfSpaces) + "*".repeat(2 * i - 1));
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ChristmasTree tree = new ChristmasTree(3);
        tree.generateTree();
        
        tree = new ChristmasTree(4);
        tree.generateTree();
        
        tree = new ChristmasTree(5);
        tree.generateTree();

        System.out.println("H");
        System.out.println("H");
        System.out.println("=====");
    }
}
